history.proof: qauto use: one_min_div, gt_le_S, divides_antisym, mult_rel_prime unfold: power inv: le.

exceptions.tactic: apply gcd_rel_prime with (b := power d n) in Hn.
exceptions.exn: Unable to apply lemma of type "forall (d a b : nat) (H : is_gcd d a b), d <> 0 -> rel_prime (quo a d (gcd_div_l d a b H)) (quo b d (gcd_div_r d a b H))" on hypothesis of type "n > 0".
Unable to apply lemma of type "forall d a b : nat, is_gcd d a b -> is_gcd d b a" on hypothesis of type "n > 0".
Unable to apply lemma of type "forall d a n : nat, rel_prime a d -> rel_prime a (power d n)" on hypothesis of type "n > 0".

In environment H7 : forall d a b : nat, is_gcd d a b -> is_gcd d b a H5 : forall (d a b : nat) (H : is_gcd d a b), (d = 0 -> False) -> rel_prime (quo a d (gcd_div_l d a b H)) (quo b d (gcd_div_r d a b H)) H : forall d a n : nat, rel_prime a d -> rel_prime a (power d n) n0 : nat -> nat -> nat d, n : nat Hn : n > 0 x0 : nat H2 : forall d' : nat, is_cd d' (x0 + 0) (n0 d n) -> divides 1 d' x : nat H1 : n0 d n = x + 0 H3, H6 : nat Unable to unify "n > 0" with "rel_prime (x0 + 0) d".

original: intros d a n Hn. apply gcd_rel_prime with (b := power d n) in Hn. apply gcd_sym in Hn. apply rel_prime_power in Hn. apply Hn.
